cyclone.name: MARIA
cyclone.category: Tropical Depression / Potential Tropical Cyclone (not yet on SSHS scale)
cyclone.current_location: about 755 mi ESE of the Lesser Antilles
cyclone.trajectory: moving west then expected to turn west-northwest toward the Leeward Islands and later the northeastern Caribbean, including vicinity of Puerto Rico
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: central or northern Leeward Islands (near Dominica–Guadeloupe corridor)

weather_observation.watch_coast: Tropical Storm Watch: St. Lucia, Martinique, Guadeloupe, Dominica
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Central and northern Lesser Antilles, U.S. and British Virgin Islands, Puerto Rico likely mid-week
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds (34–50 kt) are increasingly likely by Wednesday; peak onset probability 26% with cumulative chance 54%.
weather_observation.storm_surge: Potential surge of 1–3 ft along north and east-facing shores of Puerto Rico if the cyclone tracks near the island mid-week.
weather_observation.rainfall: Bands of heavy rain could deliver 4–8 inches with locally higher totals, causing flash-flood potential.
weather_observation.other_hazards: High surf and dangerous rip currents well ahead of the center; possible mudslides in saturated terrain.
